gurmukhi: mwgq BXo jb hI su ibdw qb Sok duh nYn bhwey ] kIno ibdw iPr XO kih kY qum XO khIXo hir ikau nhI Awey ]2258]
transliteration: Maagad Bhyo Jab Hisu Bidaa Tab Shok Duh Nain Bahaae|| Keeno Bidaa Phir Yau Kah(i) Kai Toum Yau Kaheeyo Har(i) Kio Nahiaae||2258||
translation: And asked for the permission to return, then both of them were filled with tears in sorrow and bidding farewell to him, said, “Ask Krishna, why he has not come himself?”2258.

gurmukhi: nMd qy lY jsuDw qy ibdw ciV sXMdn pY blB`dR isDwXo ] lwNGq lwNGq dyS keI ng Aaur ndI pur ky injkwXo ]
transliteration: Nand Te Lai Jasudhaa Te Bidaa Chad(i) Syandan Pai Balbhaddra Sidhaayo|| Laanhatt Laanhat Desh Kainag Aur Nadipur Ke Nijkaayo||
translation: After saying good-bye to Nand and Yashoda, Balram left on his chariot and going through several countries and crossing rivers and mountains, he reached his own city;

gurmukhi: Aw phucXo niRp ky pur ky jn kwhU qy XO hir jU sun pwXo ] Awphu sXMdn pY cV kY Aiq BRwq so hyq kY Awgy hI AwXo ]2259]
transliteration: Oo Pahouchyo Nrip Ke Pur Ke Jan Kaahoo Te Yau Har(i) Joo Soun Paayo|| Oopoh Syandan Pai Chad Kai At(i) Bhraat So Het Kai Aage Hiaayo||2259||
translation: When Krishna came to know about his arrive, he mounted on his chariot and came to welcome him.2259.

gurmukhi: AMk BRwq doaU imlY Aiq pwXo suK cYn ] mdrw pIvq Aiq hsiq Awey Apny AYn ]2260]
transliteration: Ank Bhraat Dooo Milai At(i) Paayo Soukh Chain|| Madraa Peevat At(i) Hast(i) Aae Apne Ain||2260||
translation: Both the brothers met one another with great delight and drinking wine and laughing they came to their home.2260.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy blBdR gokl ibKY jwie kr Awvq Bey ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Balbhadra Gokal Bikhai Jaae Kar Aavat Bhae||
translation: End of the description of coming of Balram to Gokul and his return in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ siRgwl ko dUq Byjbo ju hau kiRSn hO kQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Srigadl Ko Doot Bhejbo Ju Hau Krishan Hau Kathnan||
translation: Now begins the description of this message sent by Shragaal: “I am Krishna”

gurmukhi: doaU BRwq Aiq suK krq inj giH phucy Awie ] paufrIk kI iek kQw so mY khq sunwie ]2261]
transliteration: Dooo Bhraat At(i) Soukh Karat Nij Grah(i) Pahouche Aae|| Paudreek Kiik Kathaa So Mai Kahat Sounaae||2261||
translation: Both the brothers reached their home happily and now I describe the story of Pundrik;2261.

gurmukhi: dUq siRgwl pTXo hir kau kih hO hir hau quih ikau kihvwXo ] ByK soaU kir dUr sBY kib sXwm AbY jo qY ByK bnwXo ]
transliteration: Doot Srigadl Pathyo Har(i) Kau Kah(i) Hau Har(i) Hau Tuh(i) Kio Kah(i)vaayo|| Bhekh Sooo Kar(i) Door Sabhai Kabi Syaam Abai Jo Tai Bhekh Banaayo||
translation: Shragaal sent a messenger to Krishna conveying that he himself was Krishna and why did he call himself (Vasudev) Krishna? Whatever guise he had adopted, the same should be abandoned;

gurmukhi: qYry guAwr hY gokl nwQ khwvq hY fru qoih n AwXo ] kY ieh dUq ko mwn khXo nhI pyK hO lIny sBY dl AwXo ]2262]
transliteration: Taire Guaar Hai Gokal Naath Kahaavat Hai Dar(u) Toh(i) Na Aayo|| Kai Eh Doot Ko Maan Kahyo Nahipekh Hau Leene Sabhai Dal Aayo||2262||
translation: He was only a milkman; why did he not have any fear in calling himself the Lord of Gokul? It was also conveyed by the messenger, “Either he should honour the saying or face the attack of the army.”2262.
